sub_title: Rector of the Buddhist Seminary and Full Professor of Buddhist Studies at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)
summary:
As the Rector of the Buddhist Seminary at VU Amsterdam I am responsible for the education of Buddhist chaplains (spiritual caregivers) for the Netherlands on behalf of the Buddhist Union Netherlands (BUN) and Buddhist Sending Agency (BZI) funded by the the Dutch government at the VU. As a Buddhist (dharma teacher), I am committed to Buddhist values and practice.  As an academic I specialise in the study of Buddhism(s) (Philology, History, Philosophy, Anthropology), with larger interests in interdisciplinary Religious Studies and intersectional Social Justice (additional specialisations in Mythology; Queer Theory; Dis/ability Studies; Feminism; Transgender Studies; Social Theory; and Cultural Criticism). My current work focuses on Dharmology (Buddhist Critical-constructive reflection), transnational Buddhism and Globalisation; Engaged Buddhist Identity and Thought; Asian Buddhist modernism(s); Religion &Philosophy and Death, Suicide & Mental Health; Transfeminism and Queer Religion. 
I am a polyglot, fluent in German, Dutch and English, with excellent skills in classical languages including Sanskrit, Tibetan, Latin, Greek and Hebrew. I bring with me twenty years of experience in Higher Education (Teaching, Research, Leadership) from three continents with strong leadership experience in project/grant funding management, collaborations, and staff & budgeting.
My publication list includes 11 authored books, 10 edited volumes and 50+ articles & book chapters. The high volume of downloads, ‘read’s, syllabus inclusions, and quotations of key publications; and academia.edu’s top 1% ranking give some indications of the impact of my work. I have held prestigious Visiting professorships around the world and am appointed member in several professional steering committees, editorial boards, and grant funding review colleges. I edit two book series for an international academic publisher based in Oxford. 
As senior academic (full top tier [Band 3] professor previously at Canterbury Christ Church University) and mentor I am heading an international, multidisciplinary research network, coordinating annual conferences and Human Rights advocacy. 
Bringing with me substantive experience in transnational academic leadership and networking, I am the founding director of a Social Justice research centre (http://incise.center) working on intersectional issues around the globe with focus on Gender and Sexualities in the Global South.
